WorkItem.ClosedComment: Sounds like this is working now. Don't think it was meant to be re-opened.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi, 

we are trying to install TS 0.9.1.1 on a build server running Windows Server 2008 R2, but the installer is failing with 

"This version of Visual Studio requires a computer with a newer version of windows".

Looking at the download page the system requirements suggest only Windows 7 and Window 8 are supported.

Tried to copy the TS installation from C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\TypeScript from another computer, but now the compiler is failing with a blank "TSC.exe exited with code 1".

All projects are compiling correctly on a Windows 8 PC.

How do we install TS 0.9.1.1 on a Windows Server 2008 R2?

Comments.Message:
Thanks for reporting, you should be able to copy the install from a windows __7__ machine to your server.

We'll take a look at enabling installing TypeScript on a server machine.

@paulb tried three times copying the install from a Windows 8 machine and trying to build a simple, brand new TypeScript project but it fails with "tsc.exe exited with code 1".

Had to revert to 0.9.0.1, which is not ideal because we had already refactored to take advantage of bug fixes in 0.9.1.1, so a few projects are failing.

@nabog

For Windows Server 2008 R2 you need the install from a Windows ___7___ machine.

This is fixed in the next release of the TypeScript VS plugin, which you will be able to install on Windows Server 2008 R2 and up.

** Closed by paulb 10/03/2013 4:47PM

Hi, the installer for 0.9.5 Beta is still failing on a Windows Server 2008 R2.

The error messages are:

1. This version of Visual Studio requires a computer with a newer version of Windows.
2. This version of Visual Studio requires Internet Explorer 10 which is currently not installed on your computer. Please install Internet Explorer 10 and then retry installing Visual Studio.

I'm attaching the installation log.

For what it's worth I've installed 0.9.1.1 and 0.9.5 on Windows Server 2008 R2 without issue.  (I did have IE 10 installed in case that's relevant).

0.9.1.1 tested with VS 2012 and VS 2013.
0.9.5 tested with VS 2013.
